author: Bracey Harris
description: The NAACP says current operations of the xAI supercomputer Colossus in Memphis violate the Clean Air Act and are worsening pollution in the area.
title: NAACP announces plans to sue Musk's xAI over pollution concerns

author: Tim Stelloh
description: Seven Southern California men were charged in connection with what federal prosecutors described Tuesday as the largest jewelry heist in U.S. history
title: Seven California men charged in largest jewelry heist in U.S. history, prosecutors say

author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: Diddy trial judge rebukes lawyers after sealed information appears in media report

author: Monica Alba
description: President Donald Trump will extend a deadline for the owner of social media platform TikTok to find a U.S. buyer so that it can remain operating in the country, the White House said Tuesday
title: Trump set to grant another extension to avoid TikTok disruption

author: Julie Tsirkin
description: Democrats are wrestling with their strategy on cryptocurrency, a once underground industry that has become a powerful player on Capitol Hill — and closely associated with President Donald Trump
title: Democratic divisions emerge as Congress tackles crypto regulation

author: Gina Vivinetto, TODAY
description: Anne Burrell, a Food Network star and frequent TODAY guest known as much for her platinum blond hair and signature wit as her talent in the kitchen, has died at age 55
title: Anne Burrell, Food Network star and host of 'Worst Cooks in America,' dies at 55

author: The Politics Desk
description: After the targeted shootings of two Minnesota lawmakers, elected officials serving in Capitol buildings in Washington and around the country are growing increasingly worried about the level of protection they receive.
title: In Washington and across the country, lawmakers express safety fears: From the Politics Desk

author: Scott Wong
description: Senate Republicans teamed up with a bloc of Democrats to pass a landmark cryptocurrency bill that would establish the first regulatory framework for issuers of stablecoins.
title: Senate passes landmark crypto regulation bill on a bipartisan vote, sending it to the House

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: WASHINGTON — FBI Director Kash Patel said this week the bureau had shared "alarming" — but unsubstantiated — allegations about manipulation of the 2020 election with a Republican member of Congress."The FBI has located documents which detail alarming allegations related to the 2020 U.S. election, including allegations of interference by the CCP," Patel wrote, referring to the Chinese Communist Party.
title: FBI Director Kash Patel feeds 2020 election conspiracy theories with documents about unverified tip

author: Adam Edelman
description: State lawmakers across the country say they are deeply concerned about the lack of security they receive in the wake of the targeted shooting of two Minnesota legislators, even as local officials attempt to ramp up some safety measures
title: A 'wake-up call': State lawmakers are fearful after Minnesota shootings expose lack of security

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: The baby of Adriana Smith, a brain-dead pregnant woman who was being kept alive by ventilators under Georgia’s abortion law, was delivered Friday, her family said.
title: Baby of brain-dead pregnant woman kept alive under abortion law has been delivered, family says

author: Natasha Korecki
description: More than a half-dozen potential 2028 contenders have personally experienced political violence or had to manage the response to such incidents.
title: Political violence thrusts potential 2028 candidates onto the national stage

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: Rural hospitals across the U.S. — many already hanging by a thread — could take a serious hit if a proposed Medicaid cut in the Senate’s domestic spending bill is signed into law
title: How the Senate's proposed Medicaid cuts could deepen the rural hospital crisis

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: Sen. Mike Lee, R-Utah, removed posts on his personal X account about Saturday's fatal attack on a Minnesota lawmaker and her husband after facing fierce backlash from Democrats about the postings
title: Sen. Mike Lee deletes social media posts about the Minnesota shooting after facing criticism

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: Why Sabrina Carpenter’s new album cover is stirring criticism
title: Sabrina Carpenter flirts with controversy (again)

author: Angela Yang
description: Dozens of alumni from Boston University’s women’s soccer team have signed a letter supporting the team’s former coach after she was accused by podcast star Alex Cooper of sexual harassment
title: Dozens of former BU women’s soccer players sign letter supporting former coach after Alex Cooper allegations

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Police were "legally justified" when they fatally shot an 18-year-old Black man in Cincinnati last month and no charges will be filed in the May 1 death of Ryan Hinton, an Ohio prosecutor said Tuesday.
title: Ohio officer won't be charged in Ryan Hinton's fatal shooting

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — Supreme Court justices on Tuesday issued their financial disclosure reports for 2024, with Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson revealing she made more than $2 million from the publisher of her bestselling memoir, "Lovely One."Jackson, who received the book advance from Penguin Random House, is one of several justices with side-gigs as authors.
title: Ketanji Brown Jackson's $2 million book payment among Supreme Court's new financial disclosures

description: In social media posts, President Trump says the U.S. is aware of where Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is "hiding," calling him an "easy target" but adding that "we are not going to take him out." NBC News' Monica Alba and Matt Bradley report on the posts amid the ongoing conflict between Iran and Israel.
title: Trump posts that Iran's leader 'is an easy target' but U.S. will not 'take him out'

author: Ryan Nobles
description: A group of lawmakers spanning a broad ideological spectrum is raising alarms about the possibility of the United States taking an active role in the conflict between Israel and Iran.
title: A left-right coalition seeks to limit Trump's power to get involved in Israel-Iran conflict

description: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander was detained by ICE agents after “escorting a defendant out of immigration court.” Lander is also a candidate in New York's upcoming mayoral primary.
title: NYC comptroller detained by ICE agents after court hearing

author: Steve Kopack
description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said Tuesday that the company expects artificial intelligence "will reduce our total corporate workforce as we get efficiency gains" over time.
title: Amazon expects to cut corporate jobs as it relies more on AI

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: The man suspected of fatally shooting a Democratic Minnesota state representative and her husband, and wounding another state legislator and his wife, was captured in a Green Isle field on Sunday evening after a massive two-day manhunt.
title: What we know about Vance Boelter, the suspect in the Minnesota lawmaker shooting

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — Two educational toy companies on Tuesday asked the Supreme Court to quickly take up their challenge to tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump
title: Companies ask Supreme Court to quickly hear Trump tariffs challenge

description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer, D-N.Y., called for an increase in funding for U.S. Capitol Police following the shootings of two Minnesota state lawmakers. Schumer also called on President Donald Trump to ask Sen. Mike Lee, R-Utah, to take down posts on X that he said were "disgusting" reactions to the shootings.
title: Schumer calls for increased Capitol Police fund following Minnesota shootings

author: Ben Kamisar
description: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander was detained after an incident inside an immigration court in the city, a spokesperson for his mayoral campaign told NBC News Tuesday.
title: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander detained by ICE, his mayoral campaign said

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Actor David Hekili Kenui Bell, who appeared in Disney’s “Lilo & Stitch” live adaption, has died, according to his family and a representative.
title: David Hekili Kenui Bell, ‘Lilo & Stitch’ actor, dies at 46

description: For three decades, Rocking the Boat has taught Bronx teens carpentry, sailing and river preservation.
title: Meet the teens building boats to sail down the Bronx River

description: One juror has been dismissed from the Sean "Diddy" Combs sex trafficking trial and a second is under scrutiny over allegations he may have discussed the case outside of court.
title: Combs trial juror under scrutiny for outside communications

author: Diana Olick, CNBC
description: Higher mortgage rates and uncertainty in the broader economy continue to weigh on consumers — and consequently on the nation’s homebuilders
title: Homebuilder sentiment nears pandemic low as economic uncertainty plagues consumers

description: Donald Trump said in a Truth Social post that "we now have complete and total control of the Iranian skies," echoing earlier claims made by Israel. It is not clear if this means that the U.S. is intervening in the conflict between Israel and Iran. The president had previously said that the U.S. would not intervene in the conflict.
title: Trump says 'we have complete control' of Iranian skies

author: Michael Wayland, CNBC
description: DETROIT — General Motors is once again expanding its Corvette lineup with a new high-performance, hybrid variant of the quintessential American sports car
title: GM unveils quickest Corvette ever with ZR1X 'hypercar' going 0-60 mph in less than two seconds

author: Matt Lavietes
description: R. Kelly has been hospitalized after surviving what his lawyer alleged was an assassination attempt, according to court documents filed on Tuesday
title: R. Kelly hospitalized in what lawyers call an ongoing prison assassination plot

author: Hugh Son, CNBC
description: JPMorgan Chase is betting that a long list of new perks will keep affluent Americans hooked on its Sapphire Reserve card, despite a hefty bump in its annual fee
title: JPMorgan Chase unveils new Sapphire Reserve card perks and $795 annual fee

author: Sahil Kapur
description: Apple seeks to tap into a growing Formula 1 fan base in the United States with its new $200 million-plus action movie, which hits theaters on June 27.
title: Brad Pitt's new 'F1' movie brings 'immersive' Formula 1 thrills to Hollywood

author: Gabe Gutierrez
description: The president said "we're going to look everywhere' for immigration arrests, reversing last week's exemption ICE gave hotel, restaurant and agricultural workers.
title: Trump yanks brief reprieve for immigrants he said are 'good, long time workers'

author: Amin Khodadadi
description: Mehrdad Imani and his wife left Iran two years ago to start a family in "peace" in Canada.
title: Desperate Iranians try to flee Israeli bombardments

author: Rob Wile
description: A new king now reigns in TV land.
title: Streaming overtakes cable and broadcast as the most-watched form of TV

author: Leslie Josephs, CNBC
description: JetBlue Airways CEO Joanna Geraghty told staff that the carrier is implementing a host of new cost cuts as softer-than-expected travel demand is making break-even operating margins this year “unlikely.”“We’re hopeful demand and bookings will rebound, but even a recovery won’t fully offset the ground we’ve lost this year and our path back to profitability will take longer than we’d hoped.
title: JetBlue to implement budget cuts and reduce flights due to weak travel demand

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Authorities in Pierce County, Washington, used a lasso to pull a man from a pond after he allegedly chased his father with a chainsaw over the weekend, according to bodycam footage released on Monday
title: Washington deputy uses lasso to retrieve chainsaw-wielding man out of a pond

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: Dozens of Palestinians were killed as they sought food in Gaza on Tuesday, according to local health officials, in what appeared to be the deadliest single incident so far since a U.S. and Israeli-backed organization replaced established aid groups in the shattered enclave.Dr.
title: Israeli forces kill dozens of Palestinians seeking aid in Gaza, health officials say

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: WASHINGTON — Days after a Minnesota state lawmaker was killed and another injured in a "politically motivated assassination," President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he would not call the state's governor, eschewing a traditional presidential response to tragedies.
title: Trump says he won’t call Gov. Tim Walz after Minnesota shootings: 'He's a mess'

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: With eight minutes and 30 seconds left in the fourth quarter of Game 5 of the NBA Finals, the Oklahoma City Thunder were reeling
title: The Thunder got an MVP performance from the MVP's sidekick

author: Ali McCadden, CNBC
description: Kraft Heinz said Tuesday that it will remove FD&C artificial dyes from its products by the end of 2027, and will not launch any new products in the U.S. containing those ingredients
title: Kraft Heinz to remove artificial dyes from U.S. products by end of 2027

description: He said he wants "a real end" to the conflict between Israel and Iran, but has not reached out to Iran for peace talks.
title: Trump says he's looking at something 'better than a ceasefire'

description: Prosecutors laid out the chilling details of Vance Boelter’s alleged plot to stalk and kill dozens of lawmakers in Minnesota, calling his crimes “the stuff of nightmares.” NBC’s Maggie Vespa reports for TODAY.
title: Minnesota Shooting Suspect Targeted 45 Other Elected Officials

description: The fate of a juror is in limbo after an online article appeared to include details from a sealed proceeding.
title: Judge rebukes prosecution and defense over online article

description: NBC News analyst Jeremy Bash joins TODAY to weigh in on President Donald Trump’s options as the conflict between Israel and Iran enters a fifth day. “I think he wants Israel to continue its campaign,” Bash says.
title: Israel-Iran Conflict Deepens: Could the US Be Drawn In?

description: A powerful Iranian missile slipped through Israeli air defenses and smashed into a bus terminal in Tel Aviv as the conflict enters a fifth day. Israeli airstrikes continue to be unrelenting in Iran, with Israel saying its jets now have “full air superiority” over Tehran. NBC’s Richard Engel reports for TODAY.
title: Powerful Iranian Missile Slips Through Israeli Air Defenses

description: Israel’s military said it had killed Ali Shadmani, Iran’s most senior military commander, days after killing his predecessor.
title: Israel says it killed Iran’s top military commander for the second time

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Israel and Iran exchange attacks for a fifth day.
title: Israel says top Iranian military commander killed and suspect targeted other Minnesota lawmakers: Morning Rundown

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: Former Sen. Bob Menendez is scheduled to turn himself in Tuesday at a federal prison in Pennsylvania to begin serving an 11-year sentence on bribery charges
title: Former Sen. Bob Menendez set to report to prison for 11-year sentence in gold bar bribery case

author: Reuters
description: Russia launched hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles at Ukraine on Tuesday, hitting dozens of civilian targets in Kyiv including a large apartment block, killing at least 15 people and wounding scores, Ukrainian officials said.
title: Russian bombs hit dozens of civilian targets in Ukraine, killing at least 15

author: Keir Simmons
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has suggested that targeting Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and overthrowing his government could be a way to end the war that erupted when Israel launched airstrikes at the Islamic Republic last week.“We are doing what we need to do,” Netanyahu told ABC News on Monday night when asked if he plans on targeting Khamenei.
title: Israel's Netanyahu doesn't rule out targeting Iran's supreme leader and regime change

description: Video taken from a passenger plane flying over Dubai appears to show missiles being launched from Iran.
title: Video appears to show missiles launched from Iran

author: David Ingram
description: In the hours after the weekend shooting spree targeting Democratic lawmakers in Minnesota, information was still just trickling out.
title: How Minnesota shooting conspiracy theories hijacked social media feeds

author: Adam Edelman
description: Tuesday is primary day in Virginia — but the general election matchup for the commonwealth’s highest office is already set
title: Virginia's trailblazing candidates for governor prepare to battle over the economy, abortion and Trump

description: In an interview with Sky News’ Yalda Hakim, Israeli President Isaac Herzog said Iran was “rushing” to obtain nuclear weapons and that Israel had “no choice” but to attack. In recent days, attacks between the two countries have intensified after Israel launched a strike targeting Iran’s nuclear and military capabilities.
title: Israel had ‘no choice’ but to attack Iran, President Herzog says

author: The Associated Press
description: MIAMI — A hurricane watch was in effect Tuesday for southern Mexico as a tropical depression in the eastern Pacific gained strength
title: A hurricane watch is in effect for southern Mexico as a depression in the Pacific gains strength

author: The Associated Press
description: HONOLULU — A fast-moving Hawaii brush fire fueled by fierce winds forced the evacuation of about 50 Maui residents on the opposite side of the same island where a devastating blaze killed over 100 people two years ago
title: Fast-moving brush fire on Hawaii's Maui island evacuates about 50 people. No structures have burned

author: The Associated Press
description: Shohei Ohtani gave up a pair of two-strike hits and a run in his Dodgers pitching debut against the Padres on Monday night, 21 months after the two-way superstar had elbow surgery.
title: Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani makes long-awaited return to the mound after elbow surgery

author: Andrew Greif
description: Three days after the Thunder appeared headed toward a 3-1 series deficit in the best-of-seven NBA Finals, they’re now just one win away from a championship.
title: Thunder on verge of NBA championship after holding off Pacers rally to win Game 5

author: Gabrielle Khoriaty
description: The posts by Sen. Mike Lee, R-Utah, were condemned by other Democrats as well, including Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and Sen. Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota.
title: Sen. Tina Smith says she confronted Sen. Mike Lee about his 'cruel' social media posts on the Minnesota shootings

author: Zoë Richards
description: A Georgia man was arraigned Monday on charges of communicating threats in interstate commerce in connection with threats of sexual violence against Republican Sens.
title: Georgia man indicted and accused of threatening Sens. Ted Cruz and Deb Fischer

author: Scott Wong
description: Lawmakers are pushing congressional leaders to take greater steps to ensure their safety as elected officials confront the growing risk of violence.
title: Minnesota shootings reignite security concerns for members of Congress

author: Tim Stelloh
description: A California doctor agreed to plead guilty Monday to illegally supplying ketamine to “Friends” star Matthew Perry before his accidental overdose death
title: Doctor agrees to plead guilty in Matthew Perry's overdose death
